xml:
STS-51 Mission: ACTS/TOS; ORFEUS-SPAS Space Shuttle: Discovery Launch Pad: 39B Launched: September 12, 1993, 7:45 a.m. EDT Landing Site: Kennedy Space Center, Florida Landing: September 22, 1993, 3:56 a.m. EDT Mission Duration: 9 days, 20 hours, 11 minutes, 11 seconds Orbit Altitude: 160 nautical miles Orbit Inclination: 28.45 degrees
One of two primary payloads, Advanced Communications Technology Satellite (ACTS), deployed on flight day one. About 45 minutes after ACTS deploy, attached Transfer Orbit Stage (TOS) booster — flying on the shuttle for the first time — fired to propel pioneering communications technology spacecraft to geosynchronous transfer orbit.
Crew consisted of Commander Frank L. Culbertson Jr., Pilot William F. Readdy Mission Specialists James H. Newman, Daniel W. Bursch and Carl E. Walz.
